page.title: 06Belleisle Farm
page.content: Mr. Smith a dairy farmer owns Belleisle and farms 300 acres of land quarter of a mile away. He has 85 dairy cows and 2 bulls. One bull is a Hereford and the other a Freisian,a bull would cost around Â£1,000. Each bull weighs 12-15 cwt. In the morning Mr. Smith gets up at 6:00am to milk the cows,he milks them twice a day ,at 6:15am and 4:30pm. In his special milking shed he can fit 16 cows at a time,8 at each side. He has a man to help him. In the spring he cuts the grass and the baler puts it into bales. He has a container which turns the hay into silage which will be used to feed the cattle in winter. Mr. Smith's life is tedious and hard.
